they don't have the technology.

IRL, you can't see Lee sin because he is hitting you so fast.
Great idea, give him perma stealth.
{{champion:64}} If I can't see you, you won't see me!
The shield on his W acts as a Kayle ultimate and the Lifesteal portion of it acts as Sion's passive. That's not going overboard is it?
New Passive: If a lee sin is on your team you win the game... If there are 2 lee sins everyone just gets to watch a 1v1.
Also turn his E into a permanent slow debuff.
Am I the only one who thinks it would be hilarious to see a champ being kicked from base to base down midlane?

This just gave me the most amazing idea for a game mode ever.

Basically, have a 4v4 of Lee Sins and any champion you want (preferably Teemo. Just so we can call it Teemoball). evreyone gets to farm to acquire maximum cooldown reduction (would be even better with URF-like conditions). If you kick Teemo into the enemy team's fountain, you get a point.

Maybe using Lee Sin might make the cooldown a bit much for this. Alistar could work. Or maybe Vayne. Who knows?

EDIT: Please tell me someone didn't already have this idea. PLEASE
Enjoy [this ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h2XB2iIecXI)then. (Kick somewhat at 2:40. Sadly only from purple tier 2 to nexus but sorta the same idea)

that's stupid,his R is a hard to use ability and requires a lot of positioning,the least it should do is kick the guy back to lee's fountain,and drag every enemy he passes through to the fountain as well.

I mean come on,the guy only has 46% winrate now
Riot needs to get in here and add these buffs! It would be a SIN not to!
His second Q needs to be a blink. A silence might be fair, too.

His Q also needs to deal % max health true damage
E needs to blind, and silence.
He needs increased range on all spells upon leveling,also true damage and spellvamp with a stacking stun. his shield should also get stronger upon killing minions as its useless now.

What if he starts getting played competetivley? What if he gets so strong he forces other junglers out? You got to be careful with buffs. 


Wait...
If Lee sin kicks someone into the edge of the map, they go flying off the map and are unable to play for the rest of the game.  He might need more, but this is definitely a start.
No worries, they're fixing it by nerfing Sona.

Oh, Lee Sin is dominating the jungle? Yeah, let's gut mana regen, mana items and assassins - basically, let's gut mid-lane. 

#BetterNerfAssassins
Oh, ok, that seems reasonable.

This couldn't be more true.

This season has seen some absolutely MASSIVE changes to the jungle. It's gone from an 'anyone can jungle' environment to a Dark Souls-esque murder machine, which rendered many champions that were absolutely viable in previous seasons' jungles unplayable due to the jungle taking roids.

And still, even after the jungle mobs took their Venom doses, Lee Sin is still top tier.

This tells me that no matter what, short of explicitly fucking over Lee Sin in particular or outright removing him from the game, Lee will always be a top tier jungler with his current kit and numbers.

That, right there, is absolutely the DEFINITION of broken. Lee is so damn good that he's never bad. He's so damn good that the question goes from 'who can I jungle with' to 'what junglers can compete with Lee Sin?'

And that's not OK. That isn't balanced.

Unfortunately Riot is blind to this fact, that one champion being permanently viable no matter what is utterly imba as fuck.

Who isn't viable anymore exactly? The only champion that couldn't even hit 3 was Nautilus, who can now clear without problems now. 
Everyone that worked last season works now.

Why would you take any champion in this game besides Lee Sin?

He does everything in this game better than any other Jungler could ever hope to do.

Jarvan is only popular because he can COMPETE with Lee. Barely.
Because not all of us play whats OP and enjoy the champions themselves, Lee has a bloated kit but I want to see his ass keep someone locked down for several seconds like Mao Kai. He can't.

That is not a valid reason for a champion being blatantly OP.

You had the option of playing a champion other than Release Xin Zhao, but guess what, people play whats gonna net them wins in the easiest way,

Lee Sin has broken numbers, and a broken amount of things on his kit. 

A shield that gives lifesteal AND spellvamp, tied to a dash? An extremely damaging execute tied to a long range gapcloser? A strong AOE shred that debuffs all nearby enemies? A displacement cc that can knock up an entire team, while also being one of the most damaging nukes in the game?

Do you not see the problem.

Whats funny is he used to have EVEN MORE
